title: Credit Suisse Spied on More Employees Than Previously Disclosed
sub_head: As Swiss bank moves to recover from spying scandal, two prior instances of physical surveillance emerge
body:
Lawyers hired by Credit Suisse Group AG’s board in the aftermath of a spying scandal last year have found two earlier instances of employees being followed by private investigators, despite the bank’s assertions that it doesn’t condone physical surveillance.
The additional incidents of surveillance found by Homburger AG predate 2019’s high-profile scandal that involved two employees being followed, and they weren’t ordered by the same people, according to people familiar with the law firm’s findings. The findings haven’t previously...
